actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to permit a taxpayer to deduct, or to claim a credit for, amounts paid as tuition to provide education for himself, for his spouse, or for his dependents.

summary.text: Tuition Tax Relief Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a $250 income tax credit (increased to $500 over a four year period) for amounts paid as educational expenses for each dependent, their spouses, and for themselves. Allows an alternative $500 income tax deduction (increased over four years to $1,000) for the same expenses.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to permit a taxpayer to deduct, or to claim a credit for, amounts paid as tuition to provide education for himself, for his spouse, or for his dependents.
